intro: Atuna nannodes, commonly known as the small-leaf atuna, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Atuna nannodes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
